summary:
This isn‚Äôt good:
On Thursday, researchers from security firm Binarly revealed that Secure Boot is completely compromised on more than 200 device models sold by Acer, Dell, Gigabyte, Intel, and Supermicro.  The cause: a cryptographic key underpinning Secure Boot on those models that was compromised in 2022.  In a public GitHub repository committed in December of that year, someone working for multiple US-based device manufacturers published what‚Äôs known as a platform key, the cryptographic key that forms the root-of-trust anchor between the hardware device and the firmware that runs on it...
title: Compromising the Secure Boot Process
